alternate_hybrid_sigma.z_factors: ap: ap b: b ps: ps

dbze.long_name: CloudSat simulator equivalent radar reflectivity factor

depth2000m.long_name: coordinate value for 2000 m ocean depth

depth300m.long_name: coordinate value for 300 m ocean depth

depth700m.long_name: coordinate value for 700 m ocean depth

hybrid_height.z_bounds_factors: a: lev_bnds b: b_bnds orog: orog
hybrid_height.z_factors: a: lev b: b orog: orog

ocean_double_sigma.z_bounds_factors: sigma: sigma_bnds depth: depth z1: z1 z2: z2 a: a href: href k_c: k_c
ocean_double_sigma.z_factors: sigma: sigma depth: depth z1: z1 z2: z2 a: a_coeff href: href k_c: k_c

ocean_s.formula:
z(n,k,j,i) = eta(n,j,i)*(1+s(k)) + depth_c*s(k) + (depth(j,i)-depth_c)*C(k) 
 where 
 C(k)=(1-b)*sinh(a*s(k))/sinh(a) +
           b*(tanh(a*(s(k)+0.5))/(2*tanh(0.5*a)) - 0.5)
ocean_s.z_bounds_factors: s: lev_bnds eta: eta depth: depth a: a b: b depth_c: depth_c
ocean_s.z_factors: s: lev eta: eta depth: depth a: a_coeff b: b_coeff depth_c: depth_c

ocean_sigma.z_bounds_factors: sigma: lev_bnds eta: eta depth: depth
ocean_sigma.z_factors: sigma: lev eta: eta depth: depth

ocean_sigma_z.formula: for k <= nsigma: z(n,k,j,i) = eta(n,j,i) + sigma(k)*(min(depth_c,depth(j,i))+eta(n,j,i)) ; for k > nsigma: z(n,k,j,i) = zlev(k)
ocean_sigma_z.z_bounds_factors: sigma: sigma_bnds eta: eta depth: depth depth_c: depth_c nsigma: nsigma zlev: zlev_bnds
ocean_sigma_z.z_factors: sigma: sigma eta: eta depth: depth depth_c: depth_c nsigma: nsigma zlev: zlev

smooth_level.z_factors: a: a b1: b1 b2: b2 ztop: ztop zsurf1: zsurf1 zsurf2: zsurf2

time3.long_name: Diurnal cycle: monthly mean of the diurnal cycle (1 hour steps).

ps.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
ps.comment: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

p0.long_name: vertical coordinate formula term: reference pressure

depth.long_name: Sea Floor Depth: formula term: thetao

eta.long_name: Sea Surface Height formula term: thetao

c3h6.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

hcho.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

wetnh4.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean

c3h8.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

wetnh3.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean

wetso2.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean

wetso4.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean

mmrpm1.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

photo1d.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean
photo1d.long_name: photolysis rate of O3 to O1d

no2.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

ptp.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
ptp.comment: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

cli.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean
cli.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. This is calculated as the mass of cloud ice in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell. It includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

mmrno3.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

clt.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean
clt.comment: Total cloud area fraction for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

ch3coch3.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

clw.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean
clw.long_name: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
clw.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. Calculate as the mass of cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cells. Precipitating hydrometeors are included ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

cdnc.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean
cdnc.comment: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration in liquid water clouds. Question: Is this rather a 3D field?

ztp.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
ztp.comment: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

ta.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

emidust.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
emidust.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

swtoacsoaff.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
swtoacsoaff.long_name: clear sky sw-rf oaff at toa anthropogenic

od550lt1aer.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
od550lt1aer.long_name: ambient fine mode aerosol optical thickness at 550 nm
od550lt1aer.comment: od550 due to particles with wet diameter less than 1 um  (''ambient'' means ''wetted''). When models do not include explicit size information, it can be assumed that all anthropogenic aerosols and natural secondary aerosols have diameter less than 1 um.

swtoaasdust.long_name: all sky sw-rf dust at toa

o3prod.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean
o3prod.comment: ONLY provide the sum of all the HO2/RO2 + NO reactions (as k*[HO2]*[NO])

mmrpm2p5.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

rlutcs.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean

swtoaasno3.long_name: all sky sw-rf no3 at toa

emibc.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
emibc.long_name: emission rate of black carbon aerosol mass
emibc.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

swtoaasbcff.long_name: all sky sw-rf bcff at toa anthropogenic

swtoaasbb.long_name: all sky sw-rf bb at toa

zg.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

mmrso4.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

vt100.long_name: Northward heat flux due to eddies
vt100.comment: Zonally averaged meridional heat flux at 100 hPa as monthly means derived from daily (or higher frequency) fields.

wetnoy.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
wetnoy.long_name: wet deposition of noy incl aerosol nitrate
wetnoy.comment: proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_all_nitrogen_oxides_due_to_wet_deposition. NOy is the sum of all simulated oxidized nitrogen species, out of NO, NO2, HNO3, HNO4, NO3aerosol, NO3(radical), N2O5, PAN, other organic nitrates.

snc.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
snc.comment: Fraction of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell.

co2.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

dryo3.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
dryo3.comment: dry deposition includes gravitational settling, impact scavenging, and turbulent deposition.

abs550aer.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
abs550aer.long_name: ambient aerosol absorption optical thickness at 550 nm

od550ss.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean

o3loss.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean
o3loss.comment: ONLY provide the sum of the following reactions: (i) O(1D)+H2O; (ii) O3+HO2; (iii) O3+OH; (iv) O3+alkenes (isoprene, ethene,etc)

tntlw.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

od550soa.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean

mmrss.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

chepsoa.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
chepsoa.long_name: chemical production of dry aerosol secondary organic matter
chepsoa.comment: Tendency of atmosphere mass content of secondary organic matter_dry aerosol due to net production:  If model lumps SOA emissions with POA, then the sum of POA and SOA emissions is reported as POA emissions. Here, mass refers to the mass of primary organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. Instead of emi_soa in original ACCMIP Excel spreadsheet. That variable had notes: This can be a pseudo-emission flux as used in AEROCOM (Dentener et al, ACP, 2006) or the net. ''mass'' refers to the mass of primary organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_anthropogenic_secondary_particulate_organic_matter_dry_aerosol_due_to_net_chemical_production. Used instead of emi_asoa in original ACCMIP Excel spreadsheet. That variable had notes: This can be a pseudo-emission flux as used in AEROCOM (Dentener et al, ACP, 2006) or the net.

mmrdust.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

o3.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

hcl.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

plev.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean
plev.comment: The atmospheric pressure at the model layer midpoints for all times and levels in the associated output variables

emioa.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
emioa.long_name: primary emission and chemical production of dry aerosol organic matter
emioa.comment: tendency of atmosphere mass content of organic matter dry aerosol due to net production and emission.  This is the sum of total emission of POA and total production of SOA (emipoa+chepsoa). ''Mass'' refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available. Was called emi_pom in old ACCMIP Excel table. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field. ''mass'' refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. Was called emi_apom in old ACCMIP Excel table.  Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

airmass.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean
airmass.long_name: Vertically integrated mass content of air in layer

od440aer.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
od440aer.long_name: ambient aerosol optical thickness at 440 nm

wa.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

rlut.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
rlut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

reffclwtop.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
reffclwtop.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius ''as seen from space'' over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere.TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from

emiso4.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
emiso4.long_name: total direct emission rate of so4
emiso4.comment: expressed as a tendency of atmosphere mass content of SO4.  Direct emission does not include secondary sulfate production. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field. proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_anthropogenic_sulfate_dry_aerosol_due_to_emission. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

isop.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

swtoacsbb.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
swtoacsbb.long_name: clear sky sw-rf bb at toa

rsds.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
rsds.comment: surface solar irradiance for UV calculations

lwtoacsaer.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
lwtoacsaer.long_name: clear sky lw-rf aerosols at toa

mmrsoa.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean
mmrsoa.long_name: Secondary organic aerosol mass mixing ratio

toz.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean

pilev.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean
pilev.comment: The atmospheric pressure at the model layer interfaces for all times and levels in the associated output variables

od550so4.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean

oh.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

mmrbc.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

cod.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean

dryoa.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
dryoa.long_name: dry deposition rate of dry aerosol total organic matter
dryoa.comment: Tendency of atmosphere mass content of organic dry aerosol due to dry deposition: This is the sum of dry deposition of POA and dry deposition of SOA (see next two entries). 'Mass' refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone.  We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available. Was called dry_pom in old ACCMIP Excel table. Dry deposition includes gravitational settling, impact scavenging, and turbulent deposition.

rsus.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean

emiss.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
emiss.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

wetoa.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
wetoa.long_name: wet deposition rate of dry aerosol total organic matter
wetoa.comment: tendency of atmosphere mass content of organic matter dry aerosols due to wet deposition: This is the sum of wet deposition of POA and wet deposition of SOA (see next two entries). ''Mass'' refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available. Was called wet_pom in old ACCMIP Excel spreadsheet.

emibvoc.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
emibvoc.long_name: total emission rate of biogenic nmvoc
emibvoc.comment: proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_biogenic_non_methane_volatile_organic_compounds_as_carbon_due_to_emission. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field. _If_ fixed molecular weight of NMVOC is not available in model, please provide in units of kilomole m-2 s-1 (i.e. kg m-2 s-1 as if model NMVOC had molecular weight of 1) and add a comment to your file.

'mass' refers to the mass of primary organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_anthropogenic_secondary_particulate_organic_matter_dry_aerosol_due_to_net_chemical_production.  Used instead of emi_asoa in original ACCMIP Excel spreadsheet. That variable had notes: This can be a pseudo-emission flux as used in AEROCOM (Dentener et al, ACP, 2006) or the net.

emianox.comment: NOx=NO+NO2, Includes agricultural waste burning but no other biomass burning. proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_anthropogenic_nox_expressed_as_nitrogen_due_to_emission. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

cnpz.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean

so2.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

hus.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean

mcu.cell_measures: area: mean where sea time: mean
mcu.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The atmosphere convective mass flux is the vertical transport of mass for a field of cumulus clouds or thermals, given by the product of air density and vertical velocity. For an area-average, cell_methods should specify whether the average is over all the area or the area of updrafts only.

emiaoa.cell_measures: area: mean where sea_ice time: mean
emiaoa.long_name: total emission of anthropogenic  organic aerosol
emiaoa.comment: Includes agricultural waste burning but no other biomass burning. We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available. Tendency of atmosphere mass content of total organic aerosol due to emission: 'mass' refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. Was called emi_apom in old ACCMIP Excel table.  Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

emiaco.long_name: total emission rate of anthropogenic co
emiaco.comment: Includes agricultural waste burning but no other biomass burning. proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_anthropogenic_carbon_monoxide_due_to_emission. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.
